ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will say: 'Allah's.' Say: 'So how have you been bewitched?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will say: "God's." Say: "Then why are you so deluded?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They will surely say: "(The dominion over all things) belongs to Allah." Say: "Whence are you then deluded?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will reply spontaneously, "It is God." Ask them, "Why has falsehood bewitched you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Thereupon they will say, “Such greatness is only that of Allah”; say, “Then by what magic are you deceived?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will say: "(All that belongs) to Allah." Say: "How then are you deceived and turn away from the truth"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They will say: (This is) Allah's. Say: From whence are you then deceived?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They will say, 'God's.' Say: 'How then are you bewitched?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth). Say: How then are ye bewitched?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They will say, "All this belongs to God." Say to them, "How are you then deluded?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They will surely say: God's. Say thou: how then are ye turned away?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will say, ‘[They all belong] to Allah.’ Say, ‘Then how are you so deluded?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They will say, "(It belongs) to Allah." Say: "Then how are ye deluded?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will say: "(All that belongs) to Allah." Say: "How then are you deceived and turn away from the truth?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Allah' they will reply. Say: 'How then can you be so bewitched'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will say, “To God.” Say, “Then are you bewitched?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will say, "[All belongs] to Allah." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:89] They will say, ‘God.’ (a variant reading [for Allāh, ‘God’] in both instances [verses 87 and 89] has li’Llāh, ‘to God’, which is in keeping with the sense of ‘to whom belongs what has been mentioned?’). Say: ‘How then are you bewitched?’, [how then] are you duped and turned away from the truth, the worship of God alone, in other words, ‘How do you envisage [all] this to be invalid?’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: They will say: Unto Allah (all that belongeth)) all that is through Allah's power. (Say) to them, Muhammad: (How then are ye bewitched) then why do you lie about Allah; it is also said that this means, according to a different reading: see, Muhammad, how they turn away because of lies?
